title: Qakbot Malware Infection via Phishing Email
description: Qakbot banking trojan delivered via phishing email with malicious Excel attachment. Initial infection on workstation WS-PC042 spread laterally to two additional hosts before containment.
executive_summary: On February 10, 2025, at 09:15 UTC, the SOC detected anomalous network traffic originating from workstation WS-PC042 in the Finance department. Investigation revealed a Qakbot banking trojan infection initiated through a phishing email containing a weaponized Excel spreadsheet (.xlsm). The malware established persistence via scheduled tasks and attempted lateral movement to two additional workstations. The incident was contained within 2.5 hours of detection, with full eradication completed by 16:30 UTC. No data exfiltration was confirmed, though the C2 channel was active for approximately 45 minutes before blocking. Three systems were re-imaged as a precaution. This report documents the full incident timeline, indicators of compromise, and recommended remediation actions.

timeline_events.description: Phishing email received by user sarah.chen@acmecorp.com with subject 'Invoice #INV-2025-0847 - Urgent Review Required'
User opened malicious Excel attachment 'Invoice_Feb2025.xlsm' and enabled macros
Macro executed PowerShell download cradle fetching Qakbot DLL from hxxps://update-service[.]xyz/dl/patch.dll
Qakbot DLL loaded via regsvr32.exe and established persistence through scheduled task 'WindowsUpdateCheck'
C2 beacon established to 185.234.72[.]19:443 with encrypted HTTPS traffic
SIEM alert triggered: 'Suspicious Outbound C2 Communication Detected' - SOC analyst began investigation
Lateral movement detected via SMB to WS-PC019 and WS-PC055 using harvested credentials
C2 IP blocked at perimeter firewall; DNS sinkhole configured for update-service[.]xyz
All three affected workstations isolated from network. Containment confirmed.
All affected systems re-imaged. Scheduled tasks and persistence mechanisms removed. Eradication complete.
Systems restored to production. Enhanced monitoring rules deployed. User security awareness session scheduled.

iocs.context: Qakbot C2 server - HTTPS traffic on port 443
Payload delivery domain hosting Qakbot DLL
Direct download URL for Qakbot DLL payload
SHA256 hash of malicious Excel attachment 'Invoice_Feb2025.xlsm'
SHA256 hash of downloaded Qakbot DLL 'patch.dll'
Secondary C2 server observed in Qakbot config extraction
Spoofed sender domain used in phishing campaign

affected_systems.impact: Initial infection point. Full compromise - Qakbot trojan with persistence. Credentials harvested. System re-imaged.
Lateral movement target via SMB. Qakbot DLL dropped but not fully executed. System re-imaged as precaution.
Lateral movement target via SMB. Partial infection detected. System re-imaged as precaution.

recommendations: Block all identified IOCs (IPs, domains, hashes) across perimeter firewall, proxy, and EDR policies
Force password reset for user sarah.chen@acmecorp.com and all accounts that authenticated on affected systems
Deploy additional email filtering rules to block .xlsm attachments from external senders
Conduct organization-wide phishing awareness training with focus on macro-enabled document risks
Enable Attack Surface Reduction (ASR) rules in Microsoft Defender to block Office macro child processes
Implement application whitelisting to prevent unauthorized DLL execution via regsvr32.exe
Review and harden SMB access policies to limit lateral movement opportunities
Deploy enhanced Sysmon configuration with focus on process creation, network connections, and scheduled task events
Schedule follow-up threat hunt targeting Qakbot TTPs (T1059.001, T1053.005, T1021.002) across the environment
